definition: bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
Isle of Wight, island off the south coast of England

sentences.english: Mr White has converted to Buddhism.
Whitehead's philosophy meets such need of the contemporary ear.
sentences.chinese: 懷特海哲學迎合了這種時代的需要。

sentences.english: So Mrand Mrs. White took their children to the funfair Mr.
sentences.chinese: 因此，懷特夫婦帶着他們的孩子們去了遊樂場。

sentences.english: Mr White likes chatting up the girls.
sentences.chinese: 懷特先生喜歡跟姑娘們搭訕。

sentences.english: Mr. Whitelaw's benevolence would descend like soothing balm .
sentences.chinese: 懷特洛先生的仁慈就會象甘露一樣從天而降。

sentences.english: Whitesides gave one ex ample of a test th at could aid in screening for new drugs.
sentences.chinese: 懷特賽斯舉例說明一種用來輔助新藥篩選的測試法。

sentences.english: Mr. White have uncontrollable greed for fame and wealth.
sentences.chinese: 懷特先生毫無忌憚地貪求名利。

sentences.english: Along with Mocky, Miss White will be in our lesson.
sentences.chinese: 除了莫奇，這節課中還有懷特老師。

sentences.english: The huge brick house which Banker White had built on Buckey Street had overshadowed it.
sentences.chinese: 銀行家懷特在白克埃街上建的大磚屋，使它黯然失色。
他們騙取了懷特先生300英鎊。

sentences.english: Excuse me, Mr. White? I just need you to sign these before I leave.
sentences.chinese: 對不起，懷特先生？我走之前需要您在這些上籤個字。

sentences.english: White writes to his stepson in 1964 from his farm in Maine.
sentences.chinese: 懷特在他緬因的農場裏寫信給他的繼子說。

sentences.english: This gave Mr White an opportunity of collecting his thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 這就給懷特先生一個使思想集中起來的機會。

sentences.english: Does Mrs. white like peas?Yes, she does.
sentences.chinese: 懷特夫人喜歡白色豆角嗎？是的，她喜歡。

sentences.english: Boswell wrote a famous biography of Dr. White.
sentences.chinese: 鮑斯韋爾爲懷特博士寫過一本著名傳記。

sentences.english: Mr. White saved the paw from fire and wanted to have three wishes.
sentences.chinese: 懷特先生不顧朋友的警告，拿過了猴爪想許三個願望。

definition: governor (of a province or colony)/US state governor/premier (Australian states)
the Franks (Germanic people who arrived in Europe from 600 AD and took over France)
